Package controller

Class MenuController

java.lang.Object
controller.AbstractController
controller.MenuController
public class MenuController
extends AbstractController

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    MenuController()
    Constructor of MenuController aims to load all the exisiting menu items from the menu.txt file if it exists.

  • Method Summary

  • Constructor Details

    • MenuController

      public MenuController()
      Constructor of MenuController aims to load all the exisiting menu items from the menu.txt file if it exists. If the text file does not exist. It creates a new text file, as well as menu item objects, saving it into the text file created

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static MenuController getInstance()
      Method that creates an menuController object if it doesn't exist. If it exists, it returns the object reference of the current menuController
      Returns:
      an instance of menuController

    • displayMenu

      public void displayMenu()
      Method to display all the items on the Menu

    • addAlaCarte

      public void addAlaCarte​(java.lang.String name, double price, java.lang.String description, AlaCarte.Category cat)
      Creates a new Ala Carte and add it into the menu
      Parameters:
      name - the name of new Ala Carte
      price - the price of the new Ala Carte
      description - the words used to describe the new Ala Carte
      cat - the category of the new Ala Carte

    • addSet

      public Set addSet​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String description)
      Creates a new set and add it to the menu
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the new Set
      description - the words used to describe the new set
      Returns:
      the the new object reference of the set created

    • manageSet

      public void manageSet​(Set setItem)
      Method that allows the staff the manage the internal functions related to a set. For example, this method allows the staff to add item into a set or to remove an item from a set.
      Parameters:
      setItem - the set to be managed

    • updateSet

      public void updateSet​(MenuItem mItem)
      Method that allows the staff to make changes to a set, for example, the name and the description. This method allows the staff to also manage the internal functionalities of the set like adding and removing items from a set
      Parameters:
      mItem - the menuItem object which should be set

    • displayAlaCarte

      public void displayAlaCarte()
      Method that allows the staff to display all AlaCarte items - useful when staff wants to add AlaCarte items into a set

    • updateAlaCarte

      public void updateAlaCarte​(MenuItem aCarte)
      Method that allows the staff to update an AlaCarte item, for example, the name, description or price

    • getItemById

      public MenuItem getItemById​(int id)
      Method that allows us to get a menuItem from its ID attribute
      Parameters:
      id - menuItem attribute id
      Returns:
      the object reference of the menu item

    • getItemByIndex

      public MenuItem getItemByIndex​(int index)
      Method that allows us to get a menuItem from its printed index
      Parameters:
      index - index(Menu Item displayed when menu is printed) of the menuItem shown
      Returns:
      the object reference of the menu item

    • removeMenuItem

      public void removeMenuItem​(int index)
      Deletes the menuItem from the menuList by its index
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the menuItem to be deleted

    • save

      public void save​(java.lang.String filename, java.util.List al)
      This method is to save current menu items to external files.
      Specified by:
      save in class AbstractController
      Parameters:
      filename - specifies where the data to be stored
      al - specifies the list to be saved to the file

    • load

      public java.util.ArrayList<MenuItem> load​(java.lang.String filename)
      This method is to load menu items from external files
      Specified by:
      load in class AbstractController
      Parameters:
      filename - specifies where the external files stored
      Returns:
      all reservations read from the file

    • getSizeOfMenu

      public int getSizeOfMenu()
      Method that returns the size of the menu
      Returns:
      size of the Menu

    • getMenuList

      public java.util.ArrayList<MenuItem> getMenuList()
      Method that returns the object reference of the menuList.
      Returns:

    • isValidMenuItemId

      public boolean isValidMenuItemId​(int id)
      Method that checks whether a item id is an actual menu item in the list
      Parameters:
      id - id of the menu item that needs to be check
      Returns:
      returns true if id corresponding to a valid menu item, else return false
